file_content.text: Fine work out there. That stasis generator is completely totaled--no use to the Esh-kha now.
Hate to target our own infrastructure, but it had to be done.
Good thing you caught onto their plan.
Could have been worse.
Thank the Rakata for that. Heck of a surveillance system they built here.
What about other generators? This can't have been the only one.
This could happen again.
You gave those Esh-kha an awfully good licking back there. I doubt they're anxious for another dose.
We finished?
Absolutely.
I actually had a chance to watch your scuffle over the monitors--you took down those Esh-kha like a pro.
Thanks for the help. Skylast out.
If the Esh-kha manage to steal that generator, it'll mean some long and tortured lives for me and my men.
--should be getting a clear image now, sir--uh, hold on. Is... someone using the terminal?
Impossible. That whole sector's... well, shut my mouth.
General Skylast here. Surprised to see people still alive at that station.
Skylast here. Nice to see you again. Can't say I expected to find you at that tech station.
Master Jedi--General Skylast, Republic Infantry. Could use your help containing a class-A security breech in your sector.
This is General Skylast. You're with SpecOps, aren't you? We've got a class-A security breech in your sector and could use another blaster.
General Skylast here. Didn't expect I'd find anyone at that station--anyone alive, that is.
Surveillance just picked up a team of Esh-kha commandos uncoupling one of the prison stasis generators. Looks like they mean to steal it.
How'd you even know to contact us here?
This is... unexpected.
How'd you even know to find me here?
This is... unexpected.
Coincidence. We were trying to access that tech station's monitor systems. Wanted a better handle on the situation down there.
What's a stasis generator?
Stasis generators?
These generators must be important if the Esh-kha are interested.
That can't be good.
Got that right.
Those generators are a technological souvenir from the prison's Rakata builders. Kept the nastiest inmates in stasis--inmates like the Esh-kha.
The technology isn't just for pacifying criminals. Those fields will immobilize just about anything--even an entire battalion. We're talking permanent suspension here.
An eternity of imprisonment... I can't even imagine what that would be like.
Sounds dreadful.
The Esh-kha know better than anyone. Probably why they want that tech so bad--it's poetic justice.
We can't let the Esh-kha get their hands on that kind of technology.
I'll keep it safe.
Glad you think so. Our best option is to destroy the generator so the Esh-kha can't use it.
And the Republic's just been sitting on this technology?
Why aren't we using it?
All the prime Rakata technology was sealed away in the vaults, but we didn't dare open them. The Imperials didn't share our reservations.
Allowing the Esh-kha to access that kind of hardware is like giving a rancor a missile launcher--just making a bad situation worse.
We don't have time for anything fancy. I just need you to scrap that generator before the Esh-kha get ahold of it.
Those monsters will have to get through me if they want that generator.
You can count on me.
I won't let anyone unleash such a weapon on the Republic.
You can count on me.
A few well-placed explosives will keep that tech out of enemy hands.
Leave it to me.
The only thing the Esh-kha are gonna get their hands on is the underside of my boot.
Leave it to me.
I sure hope so.
Can't you do it?
Our troops can't even access that part of the prison, let alone defend it.
The Esh-kha have sent their best on this one. They've had thousands of years to mull this operation over, so stay sharp.
Stop the Esh-kha and disable that generator beyond repair. Contact me when it's done. Skylast out.
No deal. [Refuse quest]
Might change your tune if the Esh-kha ever get their hands on you.
